DOC.brief_summary: The aim study ( 1 ) test benefit non-pharmacologic anxiety management approach patient critically ill and/or traumatically injured intensive care hospitalization ( 2 ) test whether approach reduces anxiety improves engagement rehabilitation therapy , shorten duration hospitalization , improve psychological quality life outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Critical Care Anxiety Long-Term Outcomes Management
DOC.criteria: 18 year old Ability read , write , speak English Alert ( Best RASS ICU sedation score ≥2 ) Current CAMICU test negative Expected ICU stay ≥48 hour Anxiety Visual Analog Scale ( VASA ) score ≥30 Prescribed rehabilitation therapy eligibility Inability communicate ( verbally , via hand writing/gestures ) Greater 90 % probability mortality hospital Anticipated discharge hospice transition endoflife care Preexisting cognitive impairment ( e.g. , dementia , pervasive developmental disorder )
